TopicTitle: Anyone else holding off on playing KSP?

Articles.Content:
What I mean, is anyone else here waiting on playing KSP till the game is finished?

I've bought the game, and I've played around with it some, and LOVE it, but I'm purposely not playing it right now, waiting for more updates. I just don't want to get bored of this game before it's feature-complete.

I'm REALLY looking forward to the finished Career mode, and all the things that entails. There's many things I haven't gotten to do in this game yet, like going to other planets in the system, but I wanna hold those events off until I have a finished game to really enjoy it all in.

Any one else here like this? Or can you just not wait?
Not waiting. Though I just started a couple months ago after .23 was released.
When are they saying the game will "launch" ?

When are they saying the game will "launch" ?

They don't have a clue. Who knows how many new features this game will eventually have? It's impossible to tell.

When are they saying the game will "launch" ?

No one, not even Squad knows when it will make it out of Alpha. At least not datewise

There are periods where I play a lot, followed by weeks or even months where I hardly play at all. Each time new features come out or new ideas strike me that I just have to try, the game is always around for me to mess with, and it gets better every time new stuff gets added. I've really enjoyed being able to follow along and experience how much has changed over time.
Yeah, its probably going to be over a year until the game is 100% complete
I'm not holding off playing. Wish I had more time to play, as a matter of fact. Probably get bored of the game before it's finally called "complete". Or not.

To answer the question: No way! I'm in fact rushing through my current projects as quickly as possible so I can start fresh when the next Alpha version comes out

No.

I am, however, doing Sandbox at the moment. (Well, career hacked to be like Sandbox but with SCIENCE, but same difference). I'm certainly holding off playing career mode until the .24 update at least.

With mods I don't think there's anything to get bored of for a long time. Career mode just feels like an official mod to sandbox to me anyway, in the same way ARM is. If I don't want to catch asteroids I don't (I've been vaccinated) and if I don't want to grind science I don't.

Looking forwards to RT2 being fixed though. I fancy playing with communications satellites.

Why on Earth would anyone want to wait until it's finished? Why would anyone want to postpone all the fun they could have right now, on the chance that they might have more someday later? That's like buying an awesome toy, and never taking it out of the box in hopes it'll be "worth more" someday.

I know what you mean, I am doing that with several other games, like Rimworld and Project Zomboid. But this game has quite a bit to it and with all the mods and periodic updates I think it is safe to play KSP. I just started a career save using the Better Than Starting Manned mod and it changes game play considerably. And there are other ones like Real Solar System and Mission Controller that do similar things, so there is always something new to try.

KSP has been the game I play the most for the past few months. On the other hand, many of my friends are interested in the game, but they haven't bought it yet. The world is full of good games, so they feel there is no point in playing games that are still in testing stage.

It is really only Career mode left. I don't think that will be worth the wait.

By playing now, you get to be part of the "game development adventure". Something that you don't hear much of, and sadly too many don't understand or appreciate.

Some things you are missing out on...

* Enjoying all the new, changed and fixed stuff in every patch release - sometimes it's like a whole new game

* Gossip, speculation, hope, argument and all sorts of discussion about the game as it is and what it will become

* Exclusive access to game breaking bugs

* Joining in on community mob riots over disappointments
Hmmm, buying an early access alpha version of a game and then not play it because of lack of yet to be implemented features? I dont get it...
